articles.title: Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025
articles.description:
See the crowds, costumes, and spooky spirit in Witch City this year.

The post Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025 appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Salem attracted thousands of visitors for Halloween celebrations on October 31, 2025.
Costume contests featured over 100 participants showcasing creativity and local culture.
Increased tourism boosts local businesses, benefiting restaurants and shops in Salem.

articles.title: Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview
articles.description:
Rep. Seth Moulton said that it's obvious to him that President Donald Trump is in the "Epstein files."

The post Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Rep. Seth Moulton claims Trump is linked to Epstein's alleged abuse of girls.
Moulton made the accusations during a tense TV interview on October 31, 2025.
The allegations may influence public opinion and political discussions in Boston.

articles.title: Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible
articles.description:
Court preserves key cellphone evidence ahead of Walshe’s November hearing.

The post Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Court preserves cellphone evidence for Brian Walshe's upcoming hearing on November 1.
Walshe faces serious charges as evidence remains crucial for the case.
Local residents concerned about the implications of the ongoing investigation.

articles.title: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopens after asbestos scare
articles.description:
Inspectors say the asbestos was contained in a sealed stockroom and posed no risk to shoppers.

The post Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopens after asbestos scare appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopened on October 31, 2025, after an asbestos scare.
Inspectors confirmed asbestos was contained in a sealed stockroom, posing no risk to shoppers.
Local residents can resume shopping at Star Market without health concerns.

articles.title: Judges order the Trump administration to use contingency funds for SNAP payments during the shutdown
articles.description:
The judges in Massachusetts and Rhode Island gave the administration leeway on whether to fund the program partially or in full for November.

The post Judges order the Trump administration to use contingency funds for SNAP payments during the shutdown appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Judges in Massachusetts and Rhode Island mandate SNAP funding during the government shutdown.
Administration has discretion to fund SNAP partially or fully for November.
Local residents may face uncertainty in food assistance due to funding decisions.
